Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: happyfourGent
Reviews.Content: we arrived on Friday 2nd of March at Termini station. Our hotel was a 5 minutes walk from the station in a quiet street, a splendid location to start visiting a city like Rome, by foot or by public transport (metro, buses). The hotel was very clean, we had a renovated room (a room for three adults), no carpet on the floor, but tiles, which we appreciated very much. Staff was very friendly and helpfull, advising us with good addresses for diner. Breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location but room bare, poor breakfast and most staff disinterested and off-hand”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetfisher
Reviews.Content: Great central location for transport links but room bare and bland (couldn't bear to spend time in it, luckily weather was good so didn't have to!). Tiled concrete floors meant that every sound and scrape above and below was clearly heard, starting 6am or earlier. Bizarrely, the tv was located about 8 feet off the floor and CNN the only English speaking channel. Reception staff generally disinterested (but porter and cleaner more friendly). Breakfast tinned fruit, solid scrambled egg but good in parts, e.g. Fresh rolls and croissants. Not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic room”
Reviews.Author: AWal02
Reviews.Content: We travelled in April and the weather was unusually warm so the air conditioning was not on this made our room unbearable to sleep in. Staff were friendly enough but could not do anything to resolve the temperature in our room. The room was clean but basic. Breakfast was good. The location was ideal for exploring Rome and only one block from termini.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: cathy_mccarthy
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 day break in Rome - stayed in the Hotel Milani located in the Via Magenta 2 minutes from the Train station. The hotel was spotlessly clean and our room (Room 210) was really nice - recently refurbished very comfortable with a nice modern bathroom The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. We were able to use the internet ( 1e for half an hour) to book a tour of the Sistine Chapel The breakfast was very nice - selection of cereals fruit jams yougurts breads ham cheese etc They also had hot food -scrambled eggs and bacon - which was Ok Our homeward flight was late evening and although we vactaed our room we had full use of the hotel facilities - they kept our baggage for us and organised a taxi to the airport for us - 50e for 4 people much cheaper than the train We eat out in the Bar Rossi in the next street every night- the food was really good and our waiter Andre was brilliant We did an open top bus tour with Rome City Sightseeing which was very enjoyable and informative

Reviews.Title: “A great little gem with great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nick J
Reviews.Content: A wonderful welcome when we arrived from Patrizia and her colleagues. Nothing too much trouble for them in terms of advice, recommendations, great service. A lovely, spotlessly clean room with comfortable bed and bathroom. Well located right next to the Termini railway station but in a quiet, side street. Good selection for the inclusive buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay...”
Reviews.Author: bllly-nap
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel from the 5th feb until the 8th feb 2012. We arrived at 10 pm and were greeted with a smile. Check in was very quick and no problem. Our room was number 406 and when we opened the door it smelled fresh and was very clean. Good size with 2 double beds and a good sized bathroom which seemed quite newly done. Good shower and a hairdryer. When we were there it was freezing outside but the hotel was well heated and comfortable. Plenty of hot water in the morning. Breakfast was good. It included different breads and pastries, bacon ,eggs , cereals ,ham , cheese ,yoghurts , jams and spread , tea, coffee and juices. You will not need to eat elsewhere in the morning. In the tv area, tea,coffee and cold drinks are available all day and through the evening at no extra charge. Staff where always helpful and friendly and speak very good English. We would recommend this hotel because of it's location- 1 min walk to the termini station and within walking distance of many of Rome's tourist sites. We had a great time in Rome and enjoyed staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: salemmonkeysmum
Reviews.Content: Fantastic breakfast, clean hotel, fabulous rooms, maid service was excellent, staff were pleasant and helpful cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic but if you are only using it to literally lay your head somewhere in between site seeing then this is ideal but if your are seeking something a bit more luxurious i would not reccomend this. Bed was quite hard also. The breakfast was good and staff seemed friendly and happy to help on reception and had no problem with us checking in quite early. The location of the milani is very good, a two minute walk from Termini station where most coaches from either airport go to....and only a 10-15 minute walk from a lot of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “honesty and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 210.. LHS of reception-- it was just like in the photos . loved the room , would have been nice to have more English channels on the tv.. Had my own WiFi , as you can not always expect to get good wifi for free. there are a couple of cheap WiFi ,around the corner. Great location , near the Termi station. Staff were always friendy and courteous, especially the barman , had plenty of drinks at the bar , before we would go out to dinner--- Breakfast was ok . If we wanted a bigger breakfast there were plenty of other places nearby. Great Dinner restaurants , the Regina around the corner ... best homemade lasagne. Wife loved it What we found the most of the staff and manager Mr Marrella, was their extreme honesty ..as i left my wallet in my bathroom on the day of departure with over $1600 Australian dollars in value .When i rang the hotel from the otherside of customs at the airport, the hotel staff alerted me to finding it in my room . The manager Mr Marrella did jump thru hoops and spent a lot of his time to help me organise an electronic transfer back to Melbourne Australia . I got my money and he posted my wallets back to me ..It is such a pleasure to recommend this hotel ..and the staff for their efforts.. would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is its location”
Reviews.Author: brandoncwr
Reviews.Content: Rooms are bare, not as they appear in the photos. You had to pay for wireless internet - but the internet was so slow it was a joke. Using the internet in the lobby was equally slow. Breakfast was decent. The only good thing about this hotel is its location near to Termini. I definitely would not stay in this hotel again, I'm very sure you could find better hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Australians give this a miss”
Reviews.Author: Mikeybods
Reviews.Content: The rooms don't look like what they do on the photos.. I wasn't happy at all. Too many hidden costs. The buffet breakfast was tasteless and terrible. This is more like a cheap and nasty MOTEL not hotel. We were hit with a massive bill at the end. We were that disappointed we stayed somewhere else for a few nights... Avoid this place. The only thing going for it, it is 1 street from train station

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with your credit card details”
Reviews.Author: kaustuvb2001
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay online, based on the offer communicated to us, which said that breakfast was included. On receiving the booking confirmation, we found that we had to pay extra for breakfast. We immediately asked for cancellation of the booking, to which the hotel did not respond. We sent several reminders, but to no avail. We booked another hotel for our trip to Rome and stayed there. 3 months later, Milani charged my credit card for the full cost of 5 days' stay although we had never stayed there and had clearly asked to cancel our booking several times. Even when my credit card issuer took up the matter with Milani, they firmly refused to reverse the charges. I lost EUR 406 for this. Be very careful before you give out your credit card details to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BiduTraveler
Reviews.Content: What a great spot for our first (but not last!) trip to Roma. The Milani was nicely appointed, clean, nothing super fancy, but the desk staff were very helpful and willing to answer all of our inane questions. The bed was put together as a king the first night, but they separated it for us for the second two nights no problem. The breakfast was simple but amazing!! Even the little push button machine cappuccino was better than any I've ever had stateside. The hotel is located right next to the Termini station, which would have been great if we were using the trains and buses, but we ended up just taking cabs everywhere. It was still a nice area, a little off the beaten path, and I think there were a few better restaurants in our area by the hotel as well. Overall a fantastic stay and we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: GHWSydney
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located near the termini - max. 2 mins walk . This hotel is on the "quieter" side of the station. Lots of good restaurants in the same street.. Rooms are small but very clean and all amenities great. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is beaut !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the budget minded.”
Reviews.Author: seamusob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Milani from Oct 30-Nov.5. All in all it is a good hotel for the budget minded. Our room was average sized but exceptionally clean. We overlooked Via Magenta from which we could see all the traffic and pedestrian travelers. Breakfast was included and included a wide variety of fruits, muffins, yogurts,bacon and eggs. The hotel claims that they have wi-fi that you can purchase but it never worked in our room. You can opt to use a computer in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and made reservations for us for dinner. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the tube station (walking distance) and the staff were polite and helpful. The room we had was small, but clean and well-maintained. The complimentary buffet breakfast is great, there's some generic variety, which we welcomed. Overall, this was a nice hotel, conveniently located and priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you are on a budget and want to stay near the train station in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Marble_Trek
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you are on a budget and want to stay near the train station in Rome. About a 10-15 minute walk from the northeast end of the station (walk to the north exit from the mall (plaza) area. The rooms are small but clean and well maintained. The staff is friendly and somewhat helpful but don't know a lot about their own city. So don't expect concierge type service. I would not recommend staying at this hotel if you can afford to spend more and need such amenities as a concierge or someone who can help you in a new city. Summary: - Small but clean well maintained rooms - Friendly staff - Inexpensive for Rome - Close to Rome's central train station (Roma Termini) and metro - Northeast of the historic section of Rome (need to use transit to see sites) - Nice breakfast included with the rate - Solid 3-star hotel - don't expect more We used this hotel to extend our money and stay in Rome since we were also staying at the The St Regis Grand Hotel in Rome (see my review on this amazing hotel). We stayed here 3 nights on arriving in Italy and 2 nights at The St Regis before leaving Italy to fly back home after traveling to 4 other cities.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jamie W
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Milani was very easy to find after we got dropped off via coach at the Termini, a short walk from the main train station. The staff here are great, very friendly and most have a good knowledge of English. The Rooms appear very clean and tidy, With free TV and a subsidised fridge that had enough drinks in, although we never used it I would assume its topped up everytime you take something from it. The shower room was clean and although the vanity Mirror was broken on its hinge I would not hold it against them. the bad sides are not really that bad but only stuck out to me, the Key card that has to be input inside the room has 3 bright LED lights inside that when the main rooms lights are off, iluminate the whole room making it hard to face that way of a night time almost impossible to sleep with (I don't think you get this on floors 2 and up). Also the air conditioning seems to be lit up too inside which has the same problem but not so bad. The Bed's are very hard and they come with the thinnest of pillow's with only one extra pillow in the room between two. the bed sheet's are not quite warm enough for the evenings at this time of year also. the Breakfast's arn't great, the variety wasn't that extensive as some people claim. its ok if you are happy with Scramlbed egg and the rindiest of bacon for the only hot food in the morning, The Bread Rolls needed a blow torch to cut open they were that hard. The pastries were nice though. aside from all that I WOULD stay here again. the light problem was resolved by using an old reciept wrapped around the card to block out the light, the single pillow issue was not a problem as it gave me an excuse to get close to my Girlfriend every night. and as for the food we was never out of bed in time to take advantage

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Emwa90
Reviews.Content: While I wouldn't say the facilities were exceptional, the hotel was clean and comfortable. It was very close to the train station (within walking distance) making it ideal for our fleating visit to Rome. It was also very close the the starting point of the hop on hop off bus which was ideal. The breakfast was ok, although not the best we had in Europe. All up a lovely place to stay, in a convenient location and at an afforable price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & very basic”
Reviews.Author: mevanwi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milani is a good, clean, & very basic hotel. Rome is certainly worth seeing. It is spectacular. But buy a good guide & a map as the information in the streets is sparse & it can be difficult to navigate the city without a good map. HM is a small, quiet hotel & most of the residents were 40 & older. I saw no kids while we were there. Location: The best thing about Hotel Milani is its location, a 3 minute walk to Termini Central Station. At Termini, you can easily access any bus or metro lines. (Bus # 40 or # 64 will take you from Termini to Vatican City.) The public transportation service of Rome is efficient, inexpensive (1 Euro for a ticket) & will take you anywhere. There is also a bus that goes to the Airport. Many of the sightseeing places are close enough to just walk there. Piazza della Repubblica is a 10 minutes walk. We walked from the hotel to the Piazza Navona & it took us about 50 minutes. Room: The rooms are small, but very clean. However, there was only a shower & no bathtub in our room. After walking all day in the streets of Rome, a nice relaxing bath would have been nice. If you are planning to buy food at a grocery store (Despar, located also at Termini station, on the Marsala street side), know that there are no little fridge in the room. There are also no safe, but free safety boxes are available at the reception if you want to leave your passport there. If you have mobility problems, be sure to inform the hotel before you get there because some of the room are located on the 5th floor & the elevator stops at the 4th floor. There is a small TV in the room, but only Italian channels. Food: Breakfast at the hotel is also very basic. It is exactly the same thing every morning: some fruits, yogurts, cereals, jams & bread, some croissants & a coffee machine. It is a self-service. You could easily have breakfast somewhere else but just be aware that eating in Rome is expensive, and that the prices can vary considerably from one lace to another. I saw cappuccino prices varying from 1 to 5 Euros. On your way back, while at the airport, just stop at Gelateria Venchi for amazing gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable, Clean 3 star Hotel right near Termini”
Reviews.Author: lisa26186
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Milani Hotel with my mum for 3 nights in September 2011. This was our first stop on our european adventure and after reading some peoples reviews we were a lttle nervous. We arrrived from Fuimincino Airport to Termini by train and the hotel was only 5 minutes walk from the Termini. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping would clean them daily. Our room was a decent size compared to what i thought it would be like. The staff were pleasant and helpful to deal with. Breakfast was good. I felt safe walking around the area at night. Interenet connection is not all that strong but still sufficient. There are many good food places within 3 minutes walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Harpo22
Reviews.Content: We had expected a lot from previous reviews ............ our experience was much the same as Romela57 ........... rooms were tiny, staff were pleasant, security box was a small money tin at reception, rail station only a short distance ......... it can be reached by leaving the station at the Marsala side and taking one of the opposite side streets one block to Via Magenta ....... there was a lot of street noise ...... air conditioning is noisy ........ breakfast selection is above average by Italian hotel standards ...... rooms were clean ...... television in room had only 5 italian channels ...... tiny lift .........

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Romela57
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at hotel Milani in the month of August. The room that we had was rather tiny. However, the hotel was very clean and the staff very pleasant. They helped us to plan and book our tours in Rome. The hotel breakfast was better than what we had expected. The most welcoming touch to the hotel is the complimentary tea and coffee dispenser that is functional throughout the day. The hotel is very close to the railway station and has many good restaurants close by. To reach the hotel from the station, it is simpler to follow the road map rather than phone them for directions, as we went about in circles trying to follow the directions given by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 2_friends_2011
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in Rome. Very close to the central train station, lovely restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly and helpful with any requests and were happy to book tours, and point us in the direction of good local restaurants. Breakfasts were good with plenty of variety. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good service!”
Reviews.Author: malgets
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Milani Hotel - a great 3* hotel - and were totally happy with our choice! The location is perfect, it's just next to the Termini train station, the staff was really friendly and courteous. The room was not very big but clean and comfortable , the bathrom as well. The breakfast was good with a big variety of food for all tastes. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Rome staying at the Milani Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: SJW79
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that is close to the station - about a 5 minute walk. The rooms are small but you are not often in your room so as long as it is was clean it was great. The staff was friendly - especially the evening staff. There isnt free wi-fi you do have to pay for it - but it is cheap. Overall nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Friendly staff, Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: prwallah
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Milani in August 2011.The hotel is very centrally located close to the main railway station of Rome. Our room, though small, was very clean and had an effective air-conditioning. Towels and bed linen were very clean and changed everyday. The breakfast was one of the best that we had during our three weeks holiday in Italy. Hotel Milani was the only hotel that we stayed in that had a free tea, coffee or fruit juice self service throughout the day till the time the bar was not open. The English speaking tourist will have no problem as the staff speaks the language. The staff is friendly, very helpful and courteous. They will guide you with your sightseeing plans and would tell you how to go about it. There are many eating places within walking distance from the hotel, as is a small convenio store where you can pick up essentials. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iblank
Reviews.Content: I'll start from the bottom line: it's a great hotel and I highly recommend it. Now for the details: * It's location is excellent. 3 minuets from Termini station, and from there you can go anywhere. Not a noisy street but still close enough to the center (many restaurants, stores..). * The room is very good. We had a double bed (we requested), mini bar, LCD, AC and a safe. It's a bit small, but you don't need a bigger room. The room is clean a looks nice and the bathroom is also more than enough. The tv has only Italian channels, but you can connect a laptop or anything else. The bed is good, but not great, but you have no trouble falling a sleep after a long walk in Rome. * The service is very nice. There was a little (!) problem with the workers' English, but we get by. They are nice a tries to help with everything. We had a problem with the AC in the first night (it wouldn't shut down), but in the morning they fix it in 2 minutes. * The breakfast is quiet good (croissants , eggs, cheese, sausage, yogurt, corn flakes and more). I went there with my girlfriend for 4 nights (1-5/8/11) and I have only good thoughts about the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a hotel close to Roma Termini and value this is it”
Reviews.Author: KenDesa
Reviews.Content: For a base close to a transpo hub, secure and friendly, then this ticks all boxes. With luggage it's only 5 minutes to the station and less to the bus terminal. Well priced for the location and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Christinemayberry
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Large comfortable room which was a pleasure to stay in. Friendly staff and good breakfast. They were very kind in allowing us to store luggage and use facilities after we had checked out and awaiting pickup later that evening. Very good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nope, not this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Eriicsons
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome, Italy, me, hubby and teenage son. We looked for a hotel near the Termini station, where you can go straight by train from the airport. There was a lot of hotels to choose from, and the Milani hotel got some good reviews, and some not so good. And we are not picky people.. We know that we get a 3 star hotel when we pay for 3 stars At the airport, Leonardo da Vinci, we were looking for the train to Termini station, but ended up in a shuttle bus instead, which dropped us off at the hotel. It cost 45 euro. The old man in the front desk wasn´t very service minded. Sometimes he didn´t even bother to look up when spoken to. He wasn´t very keen on talking either, just answering Yes or No if we asked him something. Boring man!! He did NOTHING to make us feel welcome in his country. We had a bedroom for 3 persons. It had 2 rooms with a connecting door, that was nice for our teenage son. But the beds were hard, especially our sons. The room was spacious and clean and they changed towels every day, even if we didn´t put them on the floor for cleaning. Yes, the best thing was the room, except for the beds. Breakfast was included. Nothing to write home about. It was american buffe type of breakfast with yoghurt, bread, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon and so on. The only GOOD thing was the yoghurt. Different flavour every day. The boiled eggs were green inside, same with the scambled eggs, and the bacon didn´t seem to have been near the frying pan. The bread was of the harder kind, been too long and too hot in the micro vawe. The cappucino was also good. I think there is more to expect from a 3-star hotel than this. Yes, I forget to mention the complimentary coffee they serve in the afternoon. It tastes nothing. Don´t drink it. The location was good, near the Termini station, where you can also find buses, metro, and a lot of sightseeing tours, hop on and hof off- tours. We picked the Green Line Tours, and got off at the Vatican. There are no long distances in Rome, you can actually walk to all the famous buildings. But bring comfortable shoes! You don´t have to go hungry in this city, there are a lot of restarurants for food and ice-cream. We loved the city of Rome, with all its interesting history. But next time we will stay at another hotel, mostly because of the staff in the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT COME HERE”
Reviews.Author: aussieone40
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the hotel to check in the lady behind the front desk did not acknowledge that we were standing there. After we greeted her in english the whole check in she would speak to us in italian. She asked for our passports to check in and she would need it for an hour we questioned why she would need it so long she replied ; i just do. After all that we decided to wait for them she was done in 5 mins.... we got to our room and the air con was not working we called front desk again we spoke in english the man answered me in italian then hung up the phone while i was still talking. The concierge yelled at us in italian about the air con, called front desk to turn it on and then walked out and slammed our door. By this time we were questioning that we had made the wrong choice in picking this hotel. Everytime we left the room we had to give our key back for security purpose but when i returned from dinner i asked the man behind the desk for my key who had never met us before he handed it over to us with no hesitations. Once we returned to the room our things had been moved and our chocolates had been eaten...... we immediately found another hotel, ended up staying at Borromeo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price & Location Good, Staff Okay”
Reviews.Author: drewrich1997
Reviews.Content: Good location, a few blocks from Roma Termini train station. Price was right. Room was good with comfortable bed, AC, elevators, and shower was okay for Italy. Only negative was the front desk staff, was the least friendly for our entire 3-1/2 week honeymoon. The housekeeping staff even didn't like dealing with the front desk staff! One woman spoke in a very condescending attitude towards my husband who was speaking Italian and who had lived in Italy in the past, basically told him to just speak English, when he made one mistake. (everywhere else he got compliments for his effort) So much for trying to respect the country you are in, and at least attempting to speak the native language. Overall we would stay here again, but do everything in our power to avoid dealing with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great bed.”
Reviews.Author: jordogross
Reviews.Content: Only two blocks or so from the east exit of Termini Station. We only used this hotel as a base to get in and out of Rome. Price was pretty reasonable. Room quality was what I'd expect for the price we paid. The beds were uneven and soggy, but I can sleep on anything after walking all over the city. The room wasfiner but no view to speak of...again, worth what we paid. The internet wi-fi is extra and doesn't work in the room. You have to get close to the lobby for it to work, and then, it's slow. I'd stay here if on a budget, as the room was clean and served its purpose. I wouldn't stay here for a long stay, however.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Luciana62
Reviews.Content: Months ago, when I had booked this hotel, I wondered if I had done the right thing, especially since trying to find a good hotel in Rome is very difficult. Well I hit gold! The rooms were large, in comparison to what you would normally get, and most importantly clean! I love that there was no carpeting too. Breakfasts were in abundance and always being replenished with bacon, eggs, croissants, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, cold cuts, cheese and cereal. As for the staff, we were greeted with a big smile from Patrizia, who was always so gracious and hospitable (quite frankly, I'm not sure what the other reviewer was talking about when she said the staff was rude). No matter who was at the desk, we were always tended to with a smile. The hotel is in a perfect location too! A two minute walk to the train/bus station, which is so convenient for travel around the city. The street can get a little noisy, but with the windows shut, it was no problem....besides the air conditioning worked perfectly and they had it, which is more than I can say for some hotels in Italy! All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel...and I speak for 6 of us!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Billrodgers
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in convent location I would recommend to a relaxing holiday

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Francesco en grazie a tutto lo Staff”
Reviews.Author: PalmaArendonk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days and they treated us very good! The rooms are confortable and clean and the staff very friendly. Near to Termini station wich is very nice when you take the metro to visit the city. We will definetely come back again and stay in your hotel again. Price was good and breakfast was well organized.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel MILANI”
Reviews.Author: Alicefra
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel MILANI , Very clean, staff is very helpful and very competent, speak many languages as I know - English, French, Spanish, Russian! Rich and varied breakfast. Well-organized for sightseeing in Rome, also Capri and other places, shopping *Outlet by bus. Convenient because it is well linked to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is Rude”
Reviews.Author: Toshanicole
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay. That's it. We stayed at two different hotels in Rome on this trip and this was the worst. The front desk people were flat out rude. The one nice thing was there is a man that helps you with your bags to your room and was very nice. He was the only nice thing about this hotel. I also didn't like that it didn't have a bathtub since all of the other hotels we stayed in had one. Also, if you are a smoker, do not stay here. You can only smoke in a certain place at certain times. Also, no restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and good quality”
Reviews.Author: SofieTob
Reviews.Content: Milani hotel is in a very convenient location ( at termini - buses, trains and metro are there). I stayed at this hotel for four days in a clean and comfortable room. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I really recommend this hotel as it combines good location and good quality !!

Reviews.Title: “5 minute walk from train station, yet clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mary255068
Reviews.Content: great to be close to train station and not to have to pay a taxi to get to or from the trains or airport. clean, friendly and quiet. good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PWA
Reviews.Content: The Milani Hotel was just what we needed. We stayed here for six nights. It is in a very convenient location. We were able to walk most places. The trains and buses were located just a couple of blocks from this hotel. It was comfortable and very clean. The desk staff was for the most part helpful. Small grocery stores are nearby. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckAbroad555
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in March. The front desk was very friendly and extremely helpful. Whenever we returned from touring we were greeted with a smile, a personal hello with name, and the key to our room (which needed to be left at the front desk when out). The location was ideal for us as it is less than a 5 minute walk to the Central train station and we took a trip most days on a train pass....also handy for the Metro which was an easy way to get around Rome and see the sites. The room was large for Europe and was spotlessly clean. The breakfasts offered loads of choices and again the staff welcomed us each day by name. I would stay here again without hesitation next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel good location !”
Reviews.Author: RoozbeH
Reviews.Content: well the hotel is a two minute walk from termini station in via magenta but we looked for it for half an hour cause no body knew where it was ,just exit from the east exit and it's on the second street on ur left .. the hotel is average nothing special about it windows opend to a backyard which u don't like it ... location is good though u can walk to many thing specialy the republic square ...staff are friendly we had our cellphone stolen at the airport so they called the guy who took it many many times but if u want to book a tour bus DONOT use the ones available in the lobby cause the company has only two buses and u have to wait long times u can book them in La republik square ! breakfast was good in it's level not the best one .. but totally ok worths it for that price !

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo soggiorno nella citta eterna!”
Reviews.Author: koroleva-penskaja
Reviews.Content: It has been very nice! Everyone is friendly, all the stuff is wonderful! just like a family! No problems with the facilities! Food for breakfast is delicious and there is all you may need - eggs, omelette, bacon, sausages, nutella, juice, coffee and italian biscotti! In the bar coffee benissimo, the barmen Nino is a real gentleman! The atmosphere calm despite the location (though the street is calm, but a 5-minute walk brings you to a busy-busy quartier to Termini from where you can go to any place in the city). I advise you to go there if you are planning to visit Rome, because it is the best place you can find there!! You`ll be delighted! Ksenia

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel very close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: AthensDimitra
Reviews.Content: Milani is a 3 star hotel very close to Termini station. In around 5 minutes walk we were in Termini station, and in around 20-30 minutes we could reach Fontana di Trevi and other sights. The area might not be the best, as during the evening there were a few hobos and drunks around the street, asking for money or shouting, so better to take some precautions, specially if you are a woman walking alone. The hotel staff was ok, speaking english, but not very pleasant. Our room was a standard one, located on the 4th floor and it was comfortable and very clean. I must say that the cleaning staff did a great job every day. The furniture was a little bit outmoded, but the bathroom seemed renovated, comfortable and very clean. Maybe they could also repair the walls/ceiling, as there were some black spots of moistness in the ceiling and the wall in some areas was shelled. The breakfast room is located in the ground floor but a little bit depressing. Breakfast is ok, but I would prefer some fresh coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: mbabane
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights location was perfect for train station, hop on hop off bus. The staff were just ok, not very pleasant. The rooms were clean with a nice bathroom. Great rates. The breakfast was ok until the last day when powdered scramble eggs were left over from the day before and had a hard crust on top, bacon cold, stale buns, etc. Day before leaving some heavy weights got on the lift and it broke it. This hotel is good except for poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo helpful”
Reviews.Author: xsquealx
Reviews.Content: The staff here is extremely helpful and spoke a multitude of languages. Our room was always clean. The hotel is located right next to the train station and is centrally located in the city of Rome. You are only a 10 minute walk or train ride (1 euro each way) to almost all of the major sightseeing spots of Rome. The complimentary breakfast is pretty standard, no frills, but nothing wrong with it either. Internet is available at the rate of 30 minutes for 1 euro. Overall this was a great hotel and we cant wait to come back this October.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel if to compire with others of 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: Alina777
Reviews.Content: Absolutely recommended, best location, great services, reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Milani Hotel is in a location which is convenient for getting around Rome”
Reviews.Author: NHgrandmother
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at the Milani Hotel again. The staff was very upbeat and helpful. The breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, yogurt, fruit, croissants, juices, and coffee and there was plenty of seating available. There is a small bar off of the lobby and when you order a drink, they bring an assortment of snacks to your table to nibble on. There are several very good restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are clean and pleasant with plenty of room for two people. I was in a room facing the street and when I closed the windows at night, I couldn't hear the traffic at all.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel,Poor Breakfast...Staff need smiles painted on their faces...!!”
Reviews.Author: davy147
Reviews.Content: As with all Rome Hotels,they are over rated.Don't have great expectations...This Hotel is pretty clean but the rooms are a bit dated(except for the bathrooms they seem to have been renovated recently).There are no tea/coffee making facilities,WiFi is extra,but to be fair I believe this is stated on Hotel sales sites.Some of front desk staff need to be a bit more considerate and helpful...apart from the cleaning staff who done a wonderful job. As for the breakfast,you will have to stick to the cold food selection as the bacon and scrambled eggs leave a lot to be desired,(why can't they make decent scrambled eggs...easiest thing in the world to do...doh!!!) The bar in the hotel closes on a monday.Anyhow the location is good as it 5 mins to termini station,the area around the hotel is typical of european train station areas...but pretty safe as I never felt threatened at any time,there are a few hobo's around but 99% of them will not bother you,but as always take the usual precautions. Rome is a bit Chaotic,the bus route maps are not to be found,the underground is fine to get around,driving rules are a non starter,I used the open top tour buses for 2 days..they were pretty good value.Food in the city can be very expensive,but there are places to be found if u research a bit before you go...We found a good value Chinese near the spanish steps(recommended on trip advisor),went there twice and on both nights it was busy...Anyway I would try and get a better value hotel than this one next time I'm in Rome...Maybe the" Yes Hotel "across the street...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nearly chearful!”
Reviews.Author: griffo_ian
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 4 night stay here. Wasn't sure what to expect. Location is great and is easy to get to from the airport via bus. The area its self isn't the nicest to look at and we found it a little difficult to find somewhere nice to eat, although there are plenty of little resturantes dotted around. Did feel a little out of the night life though and would have preferred a more central location, but that means more cost and more trouble getting to it, so its a bit of a trade off. Hotel its self is a little dated but spotless and the staff could do with cheering up a little. Thought the breakfast was rubbish, plently of bread (if you get up early) but very little else, again the staff could have been a little friendlier. Room was fine (double room booked, two single beds), and cleaned to a very high standard daily. To be honest if you want to see Rome and like us were on a budget then you can't go far wrong with this, the end of the day you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great people, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Shelleyoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early September and found many things to love about this hotel. The breakfast was great, a huge selection, the coffee however not so good. There are many cafes in the area for coffee anyway. The location is perfect, very very close to the station if you have arrived from the airport or train. The tourist buses run from just around the corner. The staff were friendly, and they have a small courtyard to sit and read after a long day exploring. The superior room we stayed in was ample enough for us. Clean with a nice bathroom. Really nice hotel with great rates. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent accomodation, excellent service and a great overall value”
Reviews.Author: mvdeepak
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at a different hotel in Rome. We decided to look for a different hotel near Termini train station when we would return from a train trip to Florence. Aside from proximity to the train station, we wanted the hotel to be near the airport bus terminal to catch a plane to our next destination. We chanced upon Hotel Milani. The staff at the Front Desk was very gracious and made a reservation without asking for a cash deposit or credit card as a guarantee. They cheerfully agreed to keep our extra luggage securely in the hotel storage room for three days until we returned from Florence for our overnight stay at the hotel. The accommodation was more than adequate with a separate small room for our son. The bathroom was updated and clean. Very moderate room rate included an excellent breakfast. The airport bust terminal is one short block away - so we avoided much higher taxi or shuttle cost. The hotel location makes it very convenient for sight-seeing. Termini station provides an easy access to multiple choices of surface and subway public transit. We highly recommend the hotel for budget minded family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely close to the train station, and best shower in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: DLTada
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we were greeted by a somewhat unfriendly staff member. The other staff seemed friendly enough, but this one guy was very short tempered. Could've been a bad day, so I won't hold it against him. This hotel is a literal 5 minute walk from the train station, but it's at least a 15-20 minute walk to any other site. Rome's metro system isn't great unless you're going to the Vatican on Colosseum, so we walked pretty much everywhere. We thought that was fine, but if you don't like to walk, you may want to consider a more centrally located hotel. However, the closeness to the train station was amazingly convenient in arriving and departing, which made the stress of traveling a little easier to handle. Also, the double bed was two twin beds pushed together. This made it hard for me to sleep, but I'm a light sleeper. Also, this hotel has the best shower in Europe. No kidding.

Reviews.Title: “if you are looking for hotel in rome look elswhere”
Reviews.Author: dundeelaura
Reviews.Content: reception staff could do with a course in manners very rude and ignorant. breakfast the worst we have ever experienced .scrambled eggs handy for lining your flip flops if needed ..tables in back dining room crawling with ants one morning do not expect service with a smile . friendliness in this place is zero would never book this hotel? again . ever

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Vondavigano
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in Rome. Hotel Milani was a good choice. It is located in the city centre 2 minutes from Termini Station. Superior rooms are well furnished, very clean and comfortable, have electronic safe, LCD TV, air condition, card for opening the door. They are very clean and comfortable. I recommend to everyone. I didn't see other rooms. Staff is very friendly and very helpful. We had trouble with our digital TV signal 3rd day of our stay. It was repaired immediately after my request. Breakfast is nice but the same every day (the same salami, cheese, bread, tomato, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, ham, yoghurt, croissant, apples, stewed peaches and pears, cornflakes etc). I would suggest to change it a bit every day. I was told they are working on it. It is much better to ask waiter for another coffee. That one that is served for free from automatic machine for breakfast is not tasteful. But you definetely woun't finish breakfast with empty stomach. I guess everyone wil find his favourite food.

Reviews.Title: “roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: ted53
Reviews.Content: i spent magic moments in italy. rome is amazing and milani hotel is very good (central position and very good breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Near Termini”
Reviews.Author: Tater54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milani for one night during our cruise and caught a train for Naples the next morning to catch the ship (something I recommend to cruisers who want a bit more time in Rome. It's only about 2 hours to Naples). The Milani was only an easy 5 minute walk from the station and ideally located for sightseeing as it's near the metro and a taxi stand. When we arrived by train that morning, we just dropped our bags off at the hotel. The area was perfectly safe and we had no problems at all. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The room was quite large, especially for Italy, and very clean. The bathroom also was very large compared to most in Europe and spotless. My daughter's roll away bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of room to accomodate it. The breakfast buffet was quite good. I can highly recommend the Milani.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ibnanc3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Milani was great! Location was superb...rooms were immaculate . Staff was helpful and very friendly. The only negative remark my husband, and another couple traveling with us could say about this hotel was you had to purchase the breakfast buffet for $10 each, or you could not get a cup of coffee. We offered to buy coffee but you needed to buy the entire breakfast in order to have coffee...

Reviews.Title: “I'll choose this hotel for my next trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ksenia86
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with excellent location (opposite the central station, exactly near the platform of Leonardo express to Fiumicino airport). Very good correlation between quality and prices. Moreover, the hotel has been recently renovated: so all the equipment, sanitary engineering and furniture are in perfect condition + very friendly staff P.S. This is one of the few Roman hotels of the category that offers quite a decent breakfast, which is another tick)

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Gaz4444
Reviews.Content: Great Location, near the Central Bus & Train station, good clean, functional rooms, friendly helpful staff& good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-and-Alan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March. The hotel is central,right by the termini so v handy for the airport. Shuttlebus from Ciampino airport is quick,easy and only 8 euros return rather than 50 by taxi. The hotel was very clean with a nice general decor. The room was basic but very clean, with sheets changed daily, and a large bathroom with decent shower. The only negatives would be the beds which were definately old as sunk in the middle and need replaced! The hotel is also close to ancient Rome (20 mins walk max) but a fairly long walk from piazza navona, etc. Lots of nice restaurants near the hotel- ate at Florians round the corner twice! Overall, we got a really good deal and didn't need a fancy hotel as were out and about most of our days and evenings, so would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No, it is NOT a 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: ljwflys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights on our trip to Italy. The hotel is extremely run down, the furniture in the public area and the rooms is very dirty and shabby. The front desk staff was varying from polite and helpful to sullen depending on which clerk was on duty. You do have to pay for internet and by the time you connect if you ever do your time is up. The hotel has a very old, musty smell, the blankets and sheets in the room did too. I am always cold and got out the extra blanket and it was filthy! The faucets in the bathroom leaked around the base so everytime you turned the water on you flooded the countertop. Ok, now the good parts. It is very close to termini so convenient. The breakfast was decent and not overcrowded but then we were there in November, nothing was too overcrowded. The room though old and ratty was very large. We had a room with 2 twin beds, a sitting room with loveseat and mini refridgerator, and a huge bathroom with double sinks and a large bathtub. The bathtub was the best part of the whole room, after being on my feet all day and long soak in a hot bath with some nice bathsalts was great! We did get a very good price but I know that time of year we could have gotten something much nicer for the same price. The star rating is way off. If it was clean maybe, but it WAS NOT clean.

Reviews.Title: “RECEPTION STAFF COULDN'T HAVE BEEN MORE HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: diandphantom
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel during our recent holiday. Having read reviews on Tripadvisor, we were more than happy with our room. Although not huge it wasclean and comfortable enough for two people without being in each others space. The bathroom was quite large compared to some of the other hotels that we had previously stayed in. Breakfast was included in the cost and the dining room was easy to locate, with free coffee throughout the day if necessay, and breakfast was a nice combination of hot and cold foods. The location to Termini Station was excellent and was easy to find. We arrived in Rome after having had a wallet stolen and needing assistance to contact police and credit card agencies and the staff on reception couldnt have been more helpful and courteous. If you are looking for a comfortable 3 star hotel you cant go past this one

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 3 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 3Slaters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night as it was recommended by our Travel Agent as it was close the the Termini and we would be joining a tour the following day. Although it is close to the Termini, we would definitely not stay here again, it is worth paying the extra money for taxis to stay somewhere else. The room, although clean, was so dark and creepy and the facilities very old. The pictures look better (???) than the actual hotel. This hotel should really be only a 2 star hotel. Would not recommend it and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: mishajmo
Reviews.Content: I am really surprised this hotel has decent reviews. We booked our hotel room late and there wasn't many hotels available so I booked with Milani after reading the reviews. The only good thing about the hotel is it is near the train station and you can walk to most areas of Rome. However, I found the front desk staff to be very rude and not helpful. The hotel could use a good painting and the hallways smelled like smoke. I paid to use the internet and it hardly worked, it took forever to log onto email. The breakfast was below average. The coffee was from a machine and it was horrible. Every morning there wouldn't be enough napkins or plates or coffee cups. The beds were old and sunk in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Harmand
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days in Rome & booked the Milani Hotel for our base. It is very well situated & very clean internally. The staff were friendly & helpful. Breakfast was from a wide selection of hot & cold food, a good sized dining area well managed. One mistake we did make was to take a taxi from the Airport to the hotel, 50 euros !! On the return trip we got a coach from the Terminal for 6 euros each, they run every 30 minutes until 11.00pm

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Journey”
Reviews.Author: ale_dane
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel during my first visit to Rome. The position is really close to the station is the best point if you have in mind to use a lot public transports. The room was really clean and the service nice

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: eagle19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Termini and fairly well located to see most of the centre of Rome on foot. It was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was adequate. Internet charges were about E3 per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Frank029
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable although A/C could have been set lower. If you close the main bedroom door, the other bedroom(single bed) received none. TV's were on the small size. Breakfast was excellent. Internet/Wifi, was free although incredibly slow and frustrating. People at the service desk were friendly and accomodating. Closeness of train/subway station made for good launching point for getting around the city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent good value hotel well located for exploring City”
Reviews.Author: pearlyway
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week Booked room and on arrival asked for a quiet room. Given a superior room - safe and minibar. Room on first floor, clean, well decorated, modern shower room. Breakfast buffet style very good by italian standards with plenty of choice. Free coffee or fruit juice in middle of afternoon. Staff friendly and helpful. Well located near railway, bus station and both metro lines. Easy walk to Republic Square

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anyad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, recently renovated rooms. They were big enough for the 3 of us after a long flight, it was just what we needed. Perfect location to get around Rome, so close to the main train station, a great restaurant up the road where we had a lovely dinner one night. But the thing that always keeps this hotel in my memory was the amazing breakfast in the morning! We loved it. Pastries, rolls, cheeses, meats, eggs, so much food and so good, plus hot chocolate in your own kettle! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-round”
Reviews.Author: Grayth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milani for a three-day break with my girlfriend. On the first night, we were surprised to be told that there was no room free for us. But the porter escorted us to a nearby 4-star hotel (Royal Santino) straightaway at no extra charge. No problems. Overall the staff were helpful and friendly enough. If anything, the room at Milani was probably slightly better than that at the four-star hotel. It was nice to have a small balcony and the room was very clean, comfortable and spacious with a nice bathroom and shower. Minibar prices were also very reasonable. Breakfast was good, with a healthy choice of cereals, fruits, breads and meats (which I unfortunately managed to miss on both mornings.) The location is pretty much perfect, two minutes from Termini station and walking distance from most tourist attractions (we went for a wander and walked down the Spanish steps without even realising!) If I was planning another trip to Rome and the price remained the same, I would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walk to everything in Rome”
Reviews.Author: B4its2late8
Reviews.Content: 3 Minutes walk from main railway station, in a safe area, old hotel, old fixtures and fittings - could do with a face lift - BUT comfortable, clean and handy for walking to everything. Breakfast good and downstairs bar nice place to relax. Free internet connection in lounge.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: billme10
Reviews.Content: As I was doing a review for another hotel I decided to include the Milani as we have stayed here afew times on our way to other places in italy. We have always been in good, clean room.Nothing to complain about there.Looking onto the street on one occasion,cno noise whatsoever.Next time looking into a liile courtyard at the back,perfect. Breakfast is ok,tea, coffee.juice,rolls, toast and if your into ham ect in the morning there also.Oh must not forget the boiled egg. It is so convenient to the Terrmini,off the train,out the side to the right,cross the street,40yds on,turn left hotel just on your right.The area might not be the best,few drunks around but they are mostly at the front of station. Never had a problem here. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolWilliam
Reviews.Content: Been to Rome a couple of times now and although the "termini" area is not the best, being near to the station gives you an abundance of travel options around the city. The hotel itself was cheaper than those we used in the past and to be honest beside the decoration which is minimal we could not see a significant difference to the more expensive ones we used in the past. The rooms were clean and quite large, bathrooms hygenic, beds were comfortable. The breakfast was typical of what you get in Rome and dare I say it nearly every hotel in the world, cold meat, cheese rolls, scrambled egg, bacon,cereal, tea, coffee and fruit juice. bar area small but cheaper than drinking in most of the cafe's and retaurants, we only had a couple before going out for the evening. reception staff were helpful and didn't pass any comments even though we returned each night with our own wine to drink, saying that the mini bars in the rooms were poorly stocked. there's a supermarket near so I suppose most hotel users do the same thing as it's a lot cheaper. Rome itself was busy as normal for October, the weather was great. Overall I would go back to this hotel and would recommend it to others only if they are more interested in the sights of Rome and convenience of getting there rather than the quality of hotel and it's amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilya_T
Reviews.Content: I and my spouse stayed in the Milani Hotel for 4 nights. We arrived to Termini station by Leonardo Express from the airport and it took like 3 minutes walk with the luggage to get to hotel. The room was very nice and clean, it included a double bed, fridge, and the safe. The toilet and the shower there very clean too and renovated not a long time ago. The room had air condition system so the temperature had always been 24 C. The breakfast was a buffet that included scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, cheese and ham and a variety of cereal, yogurts and fruits for desert. The stuff was very helpful and nice. I am going to recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: aless486
Reviews.Content: i've been in this hotel last may and i really like it. For the kind hotels in Rome that i've been before this is definitely one of the best. It has a really good breakfast (a little bit early for me, it finishes at 10) but it's simply great.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ido4u
Reviews.Content: Milani hotel is located near Termini station so on your arrival to Rome, take the train! When we arrived at Milani the receptionist was very kind and spoke proper English. He gave us the key to room 103. The room was medium as i expected (as you probably know European room are usually tinny). The room didn't have shower, only a douche, which was bit disappointment for me, because after a long walking day I wanted to cool down and relax in a bath. But in general I got whatever I need in the room, even when the TV was broken, I was given a new one instead. Breakfast was great. Had all it takes to satisfy me. The waiter will bring you cappuccino, you just need to ask. During our entire stay the receptionists where very kind and helpful. Feel free to ask them for help. They know the city :) The location of the hotel is great because it's close everywhere you need to go, just few bus stops to the main streets (such as del corso) and piazzette. I must admit that termini station is not a decent place to be at night. But you just take off from there so don't worry. I also uploaded video about the hotel. For more information feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: atabh
Reviews.Content: situated 3 minutes walking distance from the roma termini station hotel offered us a newly renovated room which was spakling with granite slabs for luggage, a small sofa and 2 single beds instead of a double bed, we were told there are no double beds available but we could find one the next day. Our interest was to explore the city so we didnt care about this small inconvenience. Rooms are pretty big, very clean, and comfortable. The hop on hop off tour bus which takes you all over rome starts from right opposite the termini station so is just a 3 min walk to the bus stop. getting to the fco airport is a breeze with the airport express departing termini every 30 minutes from platform 24 costing Euro11/person. train takes 31 minutes to reach. You will see a lot of cats as you approach the hotel but they are harmless. we didnt find any homeless people or feel intimated at night near the hotel. if you walk straight down to the end of the street you will definitely see homeless people. Hotel has free internet and that was a big bonus for us, check in staff was very helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: little_miss_mise
Reviews.Content: Very nice 3 star hotel. Staff were ok helpful enough. Breakfast was ok but would have been better if they has some sort of bread to toast then it would have been better. Only down side about rooms was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities. The fact that this hotel is beside train/tram station is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AbbyT99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room which was generally clean and had everything we needed. Room service was available with a 2euro surcharge which we didnt use. Breakfast was the usual fare of cold meats, cereal, fruit and bacon and eggs. Staff were helpful and provided a free map of the area which was indispensable! We walked almost everywhere but its proximity to Termini was a godsend when we arrived after a double flight! If you feel up to it walking is the way forward as you see all kinds of things that havent made it to the guidebook but are beautiful all the same. Would definitely stay again. Only downside was a patch of mildew above the shower but that was no big deal.Its definitely worth taking tour of the colosseum, costs around 20 euros but we got a guided tour of the colosseum and palatine hill. This is more than worth the money and you jump the queue which was at least an hours wait! If you are feeling daring you can buy "dubious" handbags for about 20 euros most places but beware the fine for buying them is 10,000 euros!! Odd tip : Coffee shops require you to queue at till, pay for your drink/pastry etc and only then go and collect it! Dont forget this as they look at you with rolling eyes ;-)

Reviews.Title: “average with a smile”
Reviews.Author: cornkid
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel in a narrow street near the trainstation. Location could be better, but this is where all low/mid range hotels in Rome are. And this is a small city, so you are never far away from anything anyway. Somewhat old, simple rooms, standard size. Breakfast buffet saved three points. Friendly staff comes over to your table and serves your selection of good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatDancer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milani – Via Magenta, 12 – Rome, Italy – Ph [--] A double room(with bath) was relatively small but quiet and comfortable at 105 euros (king bed) in November 2007 and included a relatively simple breakfast. The Milani is an easy walk from Stazione Termini, Rome’s central train station.

Reviews.Title: “dont go standard”
Reviews.Author: col46uk
Reviews.Content: we booked a supieror room and thank god we did.when we first arrived and checked in the porter took us to out room and my jaw dropped.i asked if this was a standard room and he said it was,told him we booked supieror.anyway the receptionist realised his mistake and changed our room.much better this time,large,comfy,minibar and a nice bathroom. hotel location is fantastic just a short walk from the termini.ideal base to go out and about exploring.breakfast nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrgaga
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by reviewing other reviews and because it had a 3 star rating. We knew we would not be able to check in until noon, even though we got there at 10:30 a.m. after an overnight flight. We stored our bags at the hotel and went for a walk. The reception area is small and the baggage room, just off the reception area, is not locked or secure. We walked in and out twice. There were other bags there too, so if you have valuables don't leave them. They will not let you check in one minute early - even though the room is ready, so just be ready to wait. My husband slept in the chair in the lobby from 11:30 until noon when they let us to our room. Then, boy was I disappointed. The room is okay if all you want is a place to sleep. I travel quite frequently and was expecting something above a Motel 6 type hotel. The positives - the room is clean except for the mold growing all over the shower. The shower was huge and, until the heat came on, had great hot water. We think the heater also heats the water so when the heat was on (very little) the water wasn't as hot. We had a window in the shower that wouldn't close all the way, so the cold air came in while we took showers. The bath towels were great - bath sheets. Not super thick but they were nice. The sheets were changed every two to three days. We were there 8 nights and they were changed three times. The wake up calls were always on time - never late. The breakfast was decent, but basic. We aren't big breakfast eaters, so a roll and tea were fine. They had the same thing every day - fruit, eggs, rolls, yogurt. The hotel is convenient because it's two blocks from the Termini. But this is not a nice side of town. There were homeless people and drunks laying on the sidewalks. One guy, every night, was peeing on the wall and drinking his beer. It smells like urine and the streets and sidewalks are full of trash. Be aware, everyone in Rome smokes, so if this bothers you, rethink your trip. Negatives - the entire staff, except for one bellman, were very rude. No please's or thank you's for anything. The bed was awful - think of the bunkbeds you had as a kid. The spring with the mattress sitting on it? That's what this hotel has. No box spring, just a mattress on a metal base that has springs hooked to the frame. My back killed me every day! The pillows are aweful! How can a pillow be hard? I don't know, but they are here. I asked for a feather pillow or something softer, but as with most things they didn't know what I was asking about or chose not to understand. Bring your own soap, shampoo, etc. The soap bars are 1 inch by 2 inches - good for hands but nothing else. I had packed a bar of soap and that worked out. I also packed our own shampoo. They give you little packets, if you want to use them but they don't lather much at all. There is no dresser or chest of drawers. There is a wardrobe with about 8 hangers and two small drawers at the bottom. That is all the storage space. We had to stack our clothes in the bottom of the wardrobe. When you go to Italy for 10 days, you need some room to unpack. This was a pain. The place is really old. The wall paper is tearing from the walls in places and it needs to be redone. I understand some rooms have been renovated but though we asked, we weren't given one of those rooms. It's VERY noisy. The walls are super thin and you can hear everything (I mean everything) from the room next door. All of the TV is in Italian. The only English channel is MTV. Most other hotels seemed to also have CNN in English, but we didn't. We also traveled to Florence, Naples (Pompeii), and Venice. Rome and Naples are by far the dirtiest. I urge people to stay in Florence. It was beautiful there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: R_and_PMD
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, very convenient to the local Termini (Bus, train and Metro Station) and convenient to the main sites. Room was recently refurbished (not all have been - ask for a superior room) and was everyhting we needed and very clean. Staff were excellent, breakfast (continental) more than adequate and hotel spotless. A bit more pressure in the hot water system wouldn't have went amiss for the shower. Excellent value and for a 3 star hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: jd1234NewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights in June. The hotel couldn't find our reservation, so check in time took at least 45 minutes. The room was large, but we'd requested a double and got two single beds. The pillows were lumpy--they seemed as ancient as the ruins throughout the city. The second night, I slept without one. The bathroom had mildew in it. The front desk was unhelpful, however the cleaning lady was nice. Breakfast was worse than dorm cafeteria food, but the coffee wasn't bad. Worst of all, we payed 175 euros to stay there, when the night before, we'd stayed at a much nicer hotel near the Spanish Steps for the same amount of money. I tried to cancel the second night at the Hotel Milani, but we would have had to pay a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for sightseeing, refurbished rooms on right side at perfect”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: The Milani Hotel is perfectly located for exploring Rome, two streets way from the central station (Termini) it provides convenient access to all forms of public transport. Make sure that you get a room on the right side of the the hotel, as these are the renovated (superior) rooms for the same price. The service and breakfast were average, but still absolutely ok. Three rooms (e.g. 310) even have a small balcony to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milani - Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WLK440
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 travelers and although we had been planning our trip to Italy for a year plus, when we went to book hotels we wanted in fall '06, they were booked. After scrambling a bit, we "settled" on the Milani. After reading a few reviews, I was a bit apprehensive. We arrived on 4/13/07 for a two night stay, and once we were able to check in, we were pleasantly surprised. You could tell the rooms we had were newly renovated... there is still work going on in the hotel on some of the floors. My big thing is whether rooms are clean, and yes, the bedroom area and the bathroom were clean and new. Plush towels in bathroom. Only 'complaint' was that pillows were flat but that seemed the norm in other hotels I stayed in while in Italy. My room faced the street. Even though we were in Rome in early April, the weather was on the warm side during the day. The air conditioning was not functional in April so that meant sleeping with the windows open. Thay was fine from a comfort factor, but from a noise factor, it was loud. The street is narrow and sound just bounces off buildings. I was so exhausted that although some sounds were startling during the night, it wasn't totally unbearable. Breakfast was ok... it was my first time in Europe & I soon became aware that European breakfasts aren't similar to what we used to in the U.S. The "bar" is basically a room with tables and a counter area where you can order drinks. Again, something that seems to be the norm so you just adjust. You make your own fun, which we did. Some misc. points: - Location was great if you wanted to be close to the termini (train station). - There were a couple of places to eat within walking distance, and a supermarket and taxi stand a couple of blocks away but really no nightlife within walking distance. - The staff was ok, not overly friendly but certainly not rude. They would call taxis when we asked. - One key per room... when you are sharing with someone and one wants to stay in and the other doesn't, it's tough getting another key from the hotel. You need to have the key in the room if you want to keep electricity running. - Internet access (PC) in lobby available for a fee. - Small elevator... no more than a couple of people can fit and baggage. All in all, I was happy with the hotel with the exception of the location but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Milani Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petejill
Reviews.Content: I Have just returned from Italy and spent our first 7 nights at the Hotel Milani. Yes the rooms look a little tired but they are clean and a lot bigger then most hotels in Rome. I found that a lot of Italian Business people also stayed at this hotel which is a recommendation in itself. The Staff were fantastic and very helpful to us first timers, they all spoke english which helped. The other great feature is that it is only one street back from the train station. We used the Metro system to get around Rome all the time and being that close was really great, we also used the train system to go on to Florence and Venice so not having to lug our bags a long way was a plus. The breakfast was typical Cold European Contintenal but there was plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Just like HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ragan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the first night to be given a room that had an interconnecting room. All with single beds. We were a little disappointed because the room was very tired and run down. But we were too tried to complain. After one night in this room, we were pleasantly surprised when handing in the room key to head out for the day that we were going to be moved to the "renovated" section. This section was a completely different story. We were so comfortable we HONESTLY felt at home. The bed was the most comfortable we had slept in on our entire 4-month Europe trip. The bedroom was flawless. The bathroom was simply devine. The only down side to this hotel was the very disappointing breakfast!!! Otherwise, highly recommend it if you get the new section.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTSKT
Reviews.Content: Family group from Perth, Australia We have just returned from 4 nights at the Hotel Milani in Rome. We had 3 children and 3 adults in our group and were given two very comfortable rooms. One with a king size bed and two singles in a separate, but adjoining room; the other with a queen bed and single in an adjoining room. The rooms were very clean, lovely fresh sheets and thick fluffy towels. The staff spoke very good english and the staff in the breakfast room were very friendly. As this hotel is so close to the busy Termini area I was expecting it to be noisy, but it is very quite. Breakfast was excellent and included eggs, bacon, pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cheese and ham; the hot chocolate is very good as well. The hotel is very close the the Termini and this also gives you access to the hop off hop on buses. While we were a bit dubious about staying so close to the Termini (we had heard bad things about the area) we had absolutely no trouble at all. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mo7sen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in the city center. We spent a weekend in mid September and we got a double room. The rooms are quite confortable (mini-bar, safe, ...) and spacious and the complimentary continental breakfast is excellent. The staff is friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel Milani, let me start by saying this the location is terrible to say the least. I have personally seen cleaner farm barns than that area. Then you get to the Hotel which is also nothing special, the staff were not interested in helping you with much they were more worried about photo copying our passports. You check in and the receptionist tells you one think then you come back down and some one else tells you something else!! We stayed on the 4th floor, you step out of the elevator and this tangy aroma hits you like a brick wall this then follows you into the room. The bathroom in our room was dirty and the shower was very bad in regards to pressure and the water was that hot it was near impossible to bathe in it, know cold water would come out of it to add to the problem. Not impressed or happy for the amount of money we paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelArtz
Reviews.Content: We checked out this hotel on trip advisor first and decided to stay based on the price (you aren't going to be next to the Trevi Fountain on a budget) with the mostly positive reviews. We were very pleased. The room was spacious and, although a little shabby, immaculately clean. The bathroom was clean and the shower had hot water all the time. There were good double pane windows and shutters to keep the exterior noise at a minimum. The walls were a little thin, but the noise was not disturbing. The reception clerks were pleasant and helpful. They went to great lengths to help me print a tour voucher that was emailed to my yahoo account instead of faxed to the hotel. Breakfast was better than I expected. Cereal, yogurt, fruit, cold cuts, rolls, croissants, generic nutella, hot eggs (though not my thing) and bacon. The location was fine. No one really enjoys hanging out at a train station, but it was fine to walk around and the hotel is a two streets away and the "seediness" does not carry over. There are a lot of people around at all hours at the Termini (yes, it includes some homeless at night) so I never felt unsafe. Moreover, if you come out of the side of the Termini, you can avoid the buses and people out front. The location from a touring perspective was fine. We walked everywhere and occassionally rode the metro, though it closes early at night. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and Ancient Rome. We walked the whole way to Trastevere. And, here is an upside to being near the Termini- taking a bus back is so easy because the Termini is the terminus of many bus routes so whenever you see "Termini" on a bus, you can hop a ride without fear of getting lost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at Hotel Milani in Rome. I will start by saying that the location is great for getting around Rome by bus or Metro and if you want it is walkable we walked to the Colosseum. The hotel itself was clean enough the staff weren't exactly friendly apart from the cleaners. We went with another couple and each booked a double room b & b when we checked in they agreed it was two double rooms and in the new part of the hotel, but when we got to our room ours was a Twin Room. The beds were small for my husband who is 6' 2" this was not very comfortable so we asked whether we could change rooms straight away. Unfortunately we couldn't and it took them 3 days to change us after meeting with the Manager who wasn't helpful at all. They moved us into a smoking room which of course is OK if you smoke but we put up with it. The room was OK apart from the toilet not working probably , the shower head attachment didn't stay up so you had to shower whilst holding the attachment and ending up with only a couple of light bulbs working at the end of the week. (and this is the "New" part of the hotel). Also, ladies take your own hairdryers they are not what you will be used to. The hotel is pretty noisy this might not be the fault of the hotel I don't know there was a few loud bangs during the night but we never found out what they were from. The Breakfasts in the hotel were pretty poor we had it on the first day and then decided to go out for breakfast after that. The coffee is especially not very Italian!! When we came to check out the reception wanted another 20 Euro's a night per couple for an upgrade (probably the double rooms) which of course neither of the four of us were told about when we checked in, and we had already paid in full to the Travel Agent we had booked the hotel through when we booked 2 months earlier. We didn't pay this in the end but never expected this so beware! Maybe it was just bad luck but we wouldn't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect milani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome today stayed at milani and it is perfectly situated for all attraction,s lovely and clean and staff were very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamishwho
Reviews.Content: Spacious comfortable bedroom with bright modern bathroom, both kept very clean throughout stay. Staff helpful. Reception and breakfast areas furnishings rather lacking in charm. Self-service breakfast bar had cereals, various fruit dishes, yoghurts, cold ham and cheese, bread, pastries and hot scrambled/boiled eggs and bacon. The watered-down orange and grapefruit juices are best avoided. The breakfast coffee and tea brought by the waiters were fine but the complimentary coffee available during the day from flasks in the breakfast area was frankly disgusting. Hotel in convenient location near to Roma Termini a major train/metro/bus station with connections to both airports. There are a number of restaurants nearby. As in any city, the area around large stations can be dodgy. One night we found strewn on the pavement yards from the hotel the handbag and contents of what was clearly, from the diary and guidebooks, the belongings of an Italian lady traveller. No sign of purse/wallet or passport, of course. When we handed our find into our hotel reception were we told this sort of thing was not uncommon with thieves targeting passengers passing through the Termini. This hotel is clean, reasonable value for money, and a good base for sight-seeing.
